page.title: 09Smarden W - Channel Tunnel
page.content: Although the storm at present raging over the channel tunnel is causing only ripples in Smarden, it is likely to have an impact on the area, with a large increase in traffic on country lanes already overburdened. If any of the plans at present proposed go through, a large area of lovely Kentish countryside will become a vast railway marshalling yard. Villages around Ashford will be swallowed up in approach roads and urban sprawl, and the whole character of the Weald of Kent will be drastically changed. Some are for the project, many against; we wonder what those who follow after will find if the scheme goes through. Will Kent still be the 'Garden of England' or merely a 'Corridor to Europe'?
